thread.title: H.S. boys roundup: Comeback allows NFA soccer to snap 5-game slide
thread.title_full: H.S. boys roundup: Comeback allows NFA soccer to snap 5-game slide

author: The Bulletin
title: H.S. boys roundup: Comeback allows NFA soccer to snap 5-game slide
text: • Saturday's H.S. agate LEDYARD — Matt Sylvestre scored the go-ahead goal with a little more than five minutes remaining in regulation to end Norwich Free Academy’s five-game slide with a comeback win, 2-1, over Ledyard. Camden Edmond scored just before halftime for NFA (6-5, 5-3 Eastern Connecticut Conference Large), assisted by Dave Hernandez. Luis Cruz scored for Ledyard (3-10, 1-7). Bacon 4 Woodstock 0 WOODSTOCK — Colby Decker scored a pair of goals and the Bobcats won their third straight. L.J. Luster and Jake Lewis also scored for Bacon (10-1-2, 7-1 ECC Large). The Centaurs are 7-6, 3-5. Pomfret 2 Kingswood-Oxford 0 POMFRET — Nick Mazzarella and Denton Lane scored goals for the Griffins. M.K. Song and Raphael Guillebon recorded assists and Jack Bacon made six stops to earn the shutout for Pomfret (5-1-4). Marianapolis 5 St. Andrew’s 4 THOMPSON — Colin Hourihan scored the game-winner for the Golden Knights to cap a back-and-forth contest with the Saints. Trailing 2-0, Emiliano Camerena and Ryan Hourihan scored to even the score before halftime. In the second half, Arber Isufi scored on a penalty kick and Andrew Ford added a goal for Marianapolis (4-2-2) as the teams traded leads. Hyde-Woodstock 3 Williams 2 WOODSTOCK — Jonathan Bell posted a hat trick to lead the Wolfpack (3-3) and Rodney Ray Jr. made 14 saves. J.J. Johnson and Callum Tresnan scored for Williams (1-6-2). Valley Regional 2 Lyman 0 LEBANON — Andrew Perry made 15 stops in goal, but the Bulldogs (7-3-2) were shut out in the out-of-conference game. FOOTBALL New Hampton 15 St. Thomas More 7 NEW HAMPTON, N.H. — Former Windham standout Gilberto Torres ran for 130 yards and a touchdown on 19 carries, but the Chancellors turned the ball over five times in the loss. St. Thomas More has lost three straight since a season-opening win. New Hampton is 5-0. Kingswood-Oxford 60 Pomfret 16 POMFRET — Starting quarterback George Schmidt was hurt on the first offensive play of the game in the Griffins’ loss to the Wyverns. Pomfret (0-4) was forced to stick to the ground game, running the ball 52 times. Cris Rovero led the Griffins with 14 carries for 101 yards, including a 14-yard touchdown scamper. Anthony Leo (9 carries, 37 yards) also ran for a touchdown from eight yards out. CROSS-COUNTRY Golden Knights finish 4th THOMPSON — Josh Eilerman (19:28) placed a team-best seventh and Marianapolis (89) placed fourth. Page 2 of 2 - Worcester Academy (23) won the meet, followed by MacDuffie (64) and Hyde-Woodstock (69). St. Thomas More (138) placed fifth. By The Bulletin
